title: Amazing moment 'underground rockstar' serenades Tube passengers
text:
This was the hilarious moment a commuter on the London Underground was spotted singing his heart out to the Bon Jovi classic 'Livin' on a Prayer' yesterday.

Footage shows the confident singer -with his headphones in and sunglasses on - facing away from other commuters at one of the carriage doors while performing the anthem.

Other passengers can be seen smiling and laughing as the man shows off his impressive voice on the Hammersmith and City line near King's Cross in north London.

At one point the man stops at a crucial point of the chorus in an effort to get others to join in.

On his first attempt nobody sings along but when he tries again a woman on the train is heard finishing off one of the famous lines.

This prompts even more laughter from the crowds who were enjoying the funny moment.

Other passengers can be seen smiling and laughing as the man shows off his impressive voice on the Hammersmith and City line near King's Cross in north London

People on Twitter commented that the singer (pictured left) has done it before on other train journeys

The filmer said: 'I was on my usual commute from London to Wiltshire this happened!

'I heard the singing from the platform and then when I boarded the train the guy started again!

'He sang a number of songs by Bon Jovi and Aerosmith.

'He had real heart, he faced away from commuters and was clearly having a great time.'

'He made my day, it was such a wonderful way of brightening up the tube journey.'

'When he finished his songs he gave me a thumbs up and left the tube.

'It was on the Hammersmith and City line and a few people have commented on twitter that he has done it before.'
